intro: Mikania houstoniana f. apodocephala, commonly known as the Houstonian vine, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces numerous slender, hairy stems that can climb or spread along the ground. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. This variety is often found in shaded areas near streams or in forest undergrowth.
